intro: Tricalysia aulacosperma, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces woody pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tricalysia aulacosperma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks due to its vibrant floral display.
